properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 10 at 10:46PM CST until January 11 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Topeka KS
properties.description:
...Difficult Travel Conditions Tonight through Saturday
Afternoon...

Roads across the area remain slick from today's freezing rain,
sleet, and snow. While there will be a lull in the precipitation
tonight, a new round of moderate to even heavy snow moves in
before sunrise, mainly across eastern Kansas. This snow persists
through early to mid afternoon before departing.

* WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch.
Winds gusting as high as 35 mph.

* WHERE...Jackson, Morris and Wabaunsee Counties.

* WHEN...Snow moves into the area between 4 and 7 am this morning
and persists until the early to mid-afternoon hours.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Strong winds
impacting ice-coated trees and powerlines may result in a few
tree limbs breaking and isolated power outages.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED
